Invocation
Adoption of Minutes

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 226-A, in relation to requiring the police department and the department of education to provide the public with information regarding school violence.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto of Int 226-A, Provide the public with information regarding school violence.

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 322-A, in relation to requiring the New York City Police Department to provide information to the City Council regarding school safety agents.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto of Int. 322-A, Requiring the NYPD and DOE to conduct an annual review and assessment of the need for school safety agents at each school operated by the DOE.

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor – Submitting to the City Council for its approval of a maritime lease between the Department of Small Business Services and Lafarge North America for the 25th Street Pier in Sunset Park, Brooklyn pursuant to City Charter Sections 1301 (2) (f) and (g).
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Maritime Lease, Brooklyn (20055121PNK)

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Office of Management & Budget – Transfer City funds between various agencies in fiscal year 2005 to implement changes to the City’s expense budget, pursuant to Section 107(b) of the New York City Charter (MN-1)
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Transfer City funds between various agencies in FY'05 to implement changes to the City’s expense budget, pursuant to Section 107(b) of the NYC Charter (MN - 1)

Items.Title: Communication from the Office of Management & Budget – Pursuant to Section 107(e) of the New York City Charter, appropriate new revenues of $ 553.6 in fiscal year 2005 (MN-2)
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Appropriate new revenues of $ 553.6 in FY'05 (MN - 2)

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups
Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees

Resolution commending the Campaign for Fiscal Equity, the law firm of Simpson, Thatcher & Bartlett and all those who have worked with them for their continuing advocacy for the children of the City of New York, and calling upon the Governor and the State Legislature to fully and fairly provide the means to insure that all New York City school children immediately receive a sound basic education.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted. 

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Commending the Campaign for Fiscal Equity

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Governmental Operations

A Local Law to amend the charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the requirements of the campaign finance program for city elections, the requirements of transition and inauguration entities for candidates elected to the offices of mayor, public advocate, comptroller, borough president, and member of the city council, participation in the New York City Campaign Finance Program by self-funded candidates, the debate program, and limiting the use of government resources during an election year.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Introduction be Overridden by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requirements of the campaign finance program for city elections.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to application of contribution limits of the New York City Campaign Finance Program to all candidates for the offices of mayor, public advocate, comptroller, borough president, and member of the city council, and prohibiting candidates from accepting contributions, loans or security for such loans from corporations.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Introduction be Overridden by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Selected requirements of the NYC Campaign Finance Program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to application of the public disclosure requirements of the New York City Campaign Finance Program to all candidates for the offices of mayor, public advocate, comptroller, borough president, and member of the city council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Introduction be Overridden by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Application of selected requirements of the NYC Campaign Finance Program.

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 124-A, in relation to the requirements of the campaign finance program for city elections, the requirements of transition and inauguration entities for candidates elected to the offices of mayor, public advocate, comptroller, borough president, and member of the city council, participation in the New York City Campaign Finance Program by self-funded candidates, the debate program, and limiting the use of government resources during an election year.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Mayor's Message be Filed by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto of Int. No. 124-A, Requirements of the campaign finance program for city elections.

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 371-A, in relation to application of contribution limits of the New York City Campaign Finance Program to all candidates for the offices of mayor, public advocate, comptroller, borough president, and member of the city council, and prohibiting candidates from accepting contributions, loans or security for such loans from corporations.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Mayor's Message be Filed by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto of Int. No. 371-A, Selected requirements of the NYC Campaign Finance Program.

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 466-A, in relation to application of the public disclosure requirements of the New York City Campaign Finance Program to all candidates for the offices of mayor, public advocate, comptroller, borough president, and member of the city council.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to increase the penalty for the failure to register or verify an address as required by the Sex Offender Registration Act, and to require that convicted sex offenders perform their annual address verification in person.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted. 

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to increase the penalty for the failure to register or verify an address as required by the Sex Offender Registration Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to amend Megan’s Law to mandate community notification regarding sex offenders and to require local law enforcement to provide education to the public regarding such notification.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted. 

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Amend Megan's Law to mandate community notification regarding sex offenders.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the New York City Police Department’s participation in the AMBER Alert broadcast system, which allows police to rapidly notify the public that a child has been abducted, and urging that additional methods of alerting the public with comprehensive information be developed and implemented.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Supporting the NYPD's participation in the AMBER Alert broadcast system

Items.Title: Resolution commending the 20th Anniversary of the program, COP SHOT (Citizens Outraged at Police Being Shot).

Items.MinutesNote:

Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Commending the 20th Anniversary of the program, COP SHOT (Citizens Outraged at Police Being Shot).

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the New York City Charter, in relation to procurement.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: In relation to procurement

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating disclosure requirements for child care facilities.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Creating disclosure requirements for child care facilities following inspections where violations are identified.

Items.Title: Resolution to support the Untied Nations Development Corporation’s expansion plans to refurbish the Secretariat and expand its overall headquarters, which involve a small city park in Turtle Bay.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: United Nations Development Corporation’s expansion plans to refurbish the Secretariat and expand its overall headquarters, which involve a small city park in Turtle Bay.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring all children between the ages of four and eight to sit in child booster seats when traveling in any motor vehicle.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring all children between the ages of four and eight to sit in child booster seats when traveling in any motor vehicle.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to street numbers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: In relation to street numbers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to reject S.7714A and A.11873A, relating to the United Nations’ development district and expansion plans, as well as to the operation, improvement and maintenance of the Robert Moses Playground in connection with such plans.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Reject the United Nations’ development district and expansion plans (S.7714A/A.11873A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to amend the General Business Law in relation to prohibiting businesses from selling gift certificates, or issuing store credits, containing expiration dates or from adding dormancy fees, latency fees, or any other administrative fees or service charges that have the effect of reducing the total amount of the gift certificate or store credit face value.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting Gift Certificate Charges

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending annual leave to city employees who return from combat military service.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Extending annual leave to city employees who return from combat military service.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to obligating the city of New York to perform repairs upon sidewalks that remain in disrepair following the issuance of a notice of violation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Perform repairs upon sidewalks that remain in disrepair following the issuance of a notice of violation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the replacement of cobblestones or other special paving in streets in New York City when work is completed by or on behalf of the department of transportation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the replacement of cobblestones or other special paving in streets in New York City.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to naming Frank Carvill Place, Borough of Queens.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Frank Carvill Place, Borough of Queens.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the disapproval of a determination by the taxi and limousine commission to approve an application by B & R Car Service Inc. for renewal of a license to operate a base station in the borough of Brooklyn.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Base Station License, B & R Car Service Inc., Disapproval

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating orderly and responsible timeframes and paths of communication between the Campaign Finance Board and the candidates that participate in the system.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Creating timeframes and paths of communication between the Campaign Finance Board and the candidates that participate in the system.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale of aerosol spray paint cans, broad tipped indelible markers or etching acid.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Sale of aerosol spray cans, broad tipped indelible markers or etching acid.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting any motor vehicle other than a passenger car to park within fifteen feet of a street corner.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting any motor vehicle other than a passenger car to park within fifteen feet of a street corner.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the removal of snow and ice from operational motor vehicles twelve hours or more after the cessation of snowfall.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Removal of snow and ice from operational motor vehicles twelve hours or more after the cessation of snowfall.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to proscribing certain conduct at major venue sporting events.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Making it illegal for any person to subject or attempt to subject a sports participant at a professional sporting event to contact by any object or substance.

Items.Title: Resolution opposing the removal of the nest of the famous red-tailed hawk, the Pale Male, from the building at 927 Fifth Avenue in the borough of Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Opposing the removal of the nest of the famous red-tailed hawk.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Congress and President of the United States to provide a specific allocation of funding for video security systems at New York City Housing Authority developments.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Provide a specific allocation of funding for video security systems at NYC Housing Authority developments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to enforcement of the restrictions regarding engine idling.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Enforcement of the restrictions regarding engine idling.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring regular reports regarding child day care facilities.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring regular reports regarding child care facilities.

Items.Title: Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application no. C 840260 ZMM pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter, concerning changes to the zoning map, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 3.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Zoning Map Changes, Le Gans Restaurant, Manhattan (C840260ZMM)

Items.MinutesNote: At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use subcommittee.
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately: Int No. 124-A, Int No. 371-A, Int No. 466-A, Int No. 454-A and LU No. 339 & Res No. 752, LU No. 340 & Res No. 753 and LU No. 341 & Res No. 754.

See files for individual votes.

Notwithstanding the objection of the Mayor, the vetos of  Int No. 124-A, Int 466-A, and Int No. 371-A were overriden by the Council and thereby were enacted as Local Laws.

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 322-A, in relation to requiring the New York City Police Department to provide information to the City Council regarding school safety agents.
